snippet.textDisplay: i still remember  my first time entering the forest as a kid, i was so amazed at the giant trees and vines and rivers and glowing mysticsm of it all. and this sound track was the perfect addition to such a beautiful area. thanks for uploading
snippet.textOriginal: i still remember  my first time entering the forest as a kid, i was so amazed at the giant trees and vines and rivers and glowing mysticsm of it all. and this sound track was the perfect addition to such a beautiful area. thanks for uploading

snippet.textDisplay: really like how the piano line swells and arcs, underpinned by the persistent, rhythmic guitar plucking.
snippet.textOriginal: really like how the piano line swells and arcs, underpinned by the persistent, rhythmic guitar plucking.

snippet.textDisplay: This OST is arguably Sakimoto's best work in my opinion (aside from maybe Vagrant Story when I'm in a dark ambient mood). He even outshines Mitsuda here.
snippet.textOriginal: This OST is arguably Sakimoto's best work in my opinion (aside from maybe Vagrant Story when I'm in a dark ambient mood). He even outshines Mitsuda here.

snippet.textDisplay:
Such a good track! I loved this one and the atmosphere in the forest maze! I've been playing this game for 25 hours and I love it. Finding it so underrated so far!
I like the story and characters, the music, love the atmosphere and scenery and I like the battle system and gameplay too.
snippet.textOriginal:
Such a good track! I loved this one and the atmosphere in the forest maze! I've been playing this game for 25 hours and I love it. Finding it so underrated so far!
I like the story and characters, the music, love the atmosphere and scenery and I like the battle system and gameplay too.

snippet.textDisplay: Wow this is beautiful, the piano and the guitar combine so well. Makes you feel literally in a lost forest, I really miss this kind of old school games. Reminds me a bit of Chrono Trigger or maybe it's because I've been thinking lately that I would love a remake of that jewel.
snippet.textOriginal: Wow this is beautiful, the piano and the guitar combine so well. Makes you feel literally in a lost forest, I really miss this kind of old school games. Reminds me a bit of Chrono Trigger or maybe it's because I've been thinking lately that I would love a remake of that jewel.

snippet.textDisplay: Christ, I'd nearly totally forgotten about this game! Never did actually manage to complete it... A real shame - it's actually one of the best PS2 era RPGs I've ever played. Good times...

snippet.textDisplay: This game had Hitoshi Sakimoto and Yasunori Mitsuda on the same OST and has some of their best as you are hearing here. Such an underrated OST and game as a whole.
snippet.textOriginal: This game had Hitoshi Sakimoto and Yasunori Mitsuda on the same OST and has some of their best as you are hearing here. Such an underrated OST and game as a whole.

snippet.textDisplay: Waji you don't like Sakimoto? You would probably appreciate his work more if you didn't have awful early 90s hentai playing on your TV at the same time:(

snippet.textDisplay: I love them both. People often forget about Hitoshi Sakimoto though, I loved the Final Fantasy Tactics, Vagrant Story, and Radiant Silvergun soundtracks!
snippet.textOriginal: I love them both. People often forget about Hitoshi Sakimoto though, I loved the Final Fantasy Tactics, Vagrant Story, and Radiant Silvergun soundtracks!

snippet.textDisplay: But this one is Sakimoto. As much as I can't understand it since I dislike his work most of the time. He just makes a few amazing themes here and there for reasons I ignore.
snippet.textOriginal: But this one is Sakimoto. As much as I can't understand it since I dislike his work most of the time. He just makes a few amazing themes here and there for reasons I ignore.

snippet.textDisplay: I agree 100%. Mitsuda is talented. I heard this before I played Chrono Trigger and Cross, which also have terrific OSTs.

snippet.textDisplay: I agree that it's a master piece, although it only took one listen for me. From 0:51 - 1:15 (about) is easily one of the greatest pieces of music I have ever heard. It's like my ears are in Ecstasy.

snippet.textDisplay: Argh! The comments here make me greatly regret not buying this game. I loved the original, but I was stupid and let the name of the game throw me off. I mean Legaia 2: Duel Saga sounds kind of like a fighting game, also the back of the game case did not make it seem much like an RGP. I feel so dumb and wish I could play this now. This song is brilliant and apparently the gameplay is not bad either. Maybe one day...
snippet.textOriginal: Argh! The comments here make me greatly regret not buying this game. I loved the original, but I was stupid and let the name of the game throw me off. I mean Legaia 2: Duel Saga sounds kind of like a fighting game, also the back of the game case did not make it seem much like an RGP. I feel so dumb and wish I could play this now. This song is brilliant and apparently the gameplay is not bad either. Maybe one day...
